Title: Customer Segmentation Analysis for Census Marketing Campaign - AWARD
Description:
A data-driven segmentation of the England and Wales population is needed to underpin marketing and communications activities and the wider deployment of the census. This segmentation will: 
      o provide a means to understand different sections of the population, their willingness and ability to engage in the census, and their anticipated responsiveness to digital and other channels/messaging 
      o provide a consistent framework to underpin the planning, design and deployment of respondent engagement strategy and monitor its efficacy while ensuring that resources are focused on hard to reach audiences
      o build the foundation of a flexible platform that can evolve with additional data as the programme progresses 
      An established segmentation of the population of England and Wales is essential to provide a basis upon which to develop the Census specific segmentation.

Title: QU04 Birmingham Household Data & Segmentation Data Proposal - AWARD
Description:
Birmingham City Council is seeking for providers for the provision of a customer segmentation solution that enables it to have a better understanding of residents’ characteristics, behaviours and needs.  A customer segmentation toolset provides a database of information relating to the population of designated areas. It combines geography with demographics and lifestyle information to understand the different types of people in different areas. Segmentation can be used, alongside other locally held datasets, to describe geographic areas and the people living within them, allowing users to target services and communications effectively. 

Successful service providers will be required to provide a flexible and innovative service that fulfils the varying needs of the organisation. 

If you are interested in tendering please click on the following link to access Birmingham City Council’s tender Portal: 

https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register as a bidder. We will send you a log on and password so you can download the Invitation to Quote. 

Your completed Quote should be returned by 1700 hours on Wednesday 19th August 2015 using the Supplier Portal.
